name: Vegan Stuffed Peppers
description: Vegan Stuffed Peppers are filled with a "meaty" and flavorful rice vegetable mixture that is easy to make on the stovetop. A total comfort food classic and gluten-free!
recipeIngredient: 1 cup dry TVP (textured vegetable protein) (*See notes for substitutions )
2 tablespoons low sodium soy sauce (*use tamari for gluten free)
1 1/2 cups cooked white or brown rice
1 1/2 cups shredded vegan mozzarella (*homemade or store bought, may leave out)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and lightly spray a 9x13 inch casserole dish with oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and lightly spray a 9x13 inch casserole dish with oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Prep the peppers: Slice off the tops of the bell peppers and remove the seeds and ribs that are inside.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep the peppers: Slice off the tops of the bell peppers and remove the seeds and ribs that are inside.

recipeInstructions.text: Pre-cook the peppers: Place the peppers in the casserole dish cut side down. Pour 1 1/2 cups water into the dish around the peppers. Cover with foil and place in the oven for 25 minutes. This will soften the peppers somewhat, making them more tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Pre-cook the peppers: Place the peppers in the casserole dish cut side down. Pour 1 1/2 cups water into the dish around the peppers. Cover with foil and place in the oven for 25 minutes. This will soften the peppers somewhat, making them more tender.

recipeInstructions.text: While the peppers are pre-cooking, make the filling: In a large skillet, add the dry TVP and 2 cups of water. Bring to a boil on high heat and cook for 5-10 minutes, until all the water is absorbed.
recipeInstructions.name: While the peppers are pre-cooking, make the filling: In a large skillet, add the dry TVP and 2 cups of water. Bring to a boil on high heat and cook for 5-10 minutes, until all the water is absorbed.

recipeInstructions.text: Now add the olive oil, diced onion, garlic, soy sauce, oregano and basil to the skillet and cook for 5-10 minutes over medium heat. Stir in the cooked rice and tomato sauce, and add salt + pepper to taste. Stir in 1/2 cup of the vegan cheese, if using. Remove the filling from heat and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Now add the olive oil, diced onion, garlic, soy sauce, oregano and basil to the skillet and cook for 5-10 minutes over medium heat. Stir in the cooked rice and tomato sauce, and add salt + pepper to taste. Stir in 1/2 cup of the vegan cheese, if using. Remove the filling from heat and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the peppers from the oven and drain off the excess water, carefully. When the peppers are cool enough to handle, flip them over in the casserole dish and fill each one with the filling.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the peppers from the oven and drain off the excess water, carefully. When the peppers are cool enough to handle, flip them over in the casserole dish and fill each one with the filling.

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle the rest of the vegan cheese on each pepper evenly and bake for about 30 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped parsley if desired and serve immediately.
